data.title: Nice place to dine.
data.text: This is a relative new restaurant, and has a good variety of food choices.  The quality of the food was good, and prices were about the norm for the area.  The drinks are also good, and not overpriced.  If you like the late nite music crowd this place really gets hopping.  They also have an outdoor patio, with plans to open a rooftop retreat.  This is a very nice family run place, and I plan on going back real soon.

data.title: Quality is inconsistent
data.text: I've been here 3-4 times.  Once it was fantastic, once it wasn't good at all, and twice is was so-so.  That is true of both the food and the service.

data.title: Birthday
data.text: The food is awesome.  The meat combo is fantastic.   Cocktails are great.  The ambience is nice.   Spacious seating.

data.title: Food was average at best
data.text:
After hearing some favorable reviews of this place, we decided to try it out. It was a weeknight. The waitress told us that it was a "sport night" so the back was reserved for sport fans. The Angel Game was on but there was not much else on TV other than ESPN News. There were about half a dozen people in this area. We were place in a booth in front of a bunch of TV's. 2 of the large screens were showing the same Angel Game on different channels. So much for the sport-night. 

We both ordered the BBQ brisket. The waitress took forever to get our food, despite the place being pretty empty. The brisket was dry and smothered in BBQ sauce. The sauce is good but nothing special. 

All in all, we were not impressed with this place. I guess it must be busy on the weekends but on this weekday night, it was pretty sad. Prices were OK but high considering the quality of the food.

data.title: A great place
data.text: Its a BBQ Sports Restaurant.  How great is that.  The pull pork sandwich I found to be very tasty.  I've had the wings too.  You can't go wrong here

data.title: Needs to Clean up thier restrooms..Food was ok.
data.text: We arrived around 5:30 on a Saturday night to a nearly empty restaurant.  Our waitress was nice, and took our order quickly.  The food was of large portions, and enough to share.  My wife and I shared the 3 meat dinner plate, with beef ribs, pulled pork, and brisket.  The meats were good, not the best I have ever had, but better than some other local bbq places I’ve visited.  Everything was great until I decided to take a trip to the restroom after finishing our meal.  Upon entering the restroom, I was greeted with a foul stench of vomit, and noticed a large projectile stain of dried vomit on the wall, and all over the floor.  It looked like it had been there long enough to dry.  While I was in the bathroom, a member of the staff came in, with a large cooking style pot, sat it into the sink, turned on the faucet, and proceeded to exit the bathroom.  I can only hope they were not taking cookware into restrooms to fill with water, especially with vomit lingering.  If I would have seen this upon arriving, I would have left immediately.  Overall the food was good, but seeing the conditions of the bathroom, and them using the bathroom sink for possible kitchen uses, I might think twice before returning.

data.title: A Good Experience
data.text: I had an excellent BBQ Cobb Salad, plentiful with fresh ingredients.  Our server was excellent and I'd go back again.  Perhaps this is more a sports bar than a traditional restaurant, judging from the number of TVs on the walls.

data.title: Will not recommend
data.text: Horrible.  One of the worst dining experiences of my life.  We came here because another site recommended it highly.  The dining area was only about 15% occupied at 5:30 on a Saturday night.  WE figured we were ahead of the evening rush.  The hostess did her job by sitting us.  Then after a few minutes someone came by to ask if we had been taken care of?  Since we had no menus, water or dirks I didn't think I had to answer the question.  I held back on my sarcasm.  Someone else arrived and introduced herself as the manager and immediately complained that a worker hadn't shown up for work.  Not our problem!  She took our order for drinks.  Then some guy shows up with our two Arnold Palmers and a glass of wine for my gal.  OMG, when he set the wine on the table we all noticed that he had his entire palm resting on the rim of the glass.  He realized his mistake and took the glass back.  Our Tea drinks were not Arnold Palmers!  When the manager returned I informed her that they forgot to add the lemonade to the drinks.  I asked her who made the APs and she said she did.  I asked her what makes an AP  She said she knew the ingredients.  I told her that she did not..  It seemed the she wanted to make a point that the customer is not always right.    She took the drinks away and returned with just about the same tea colored drinks!  Forget it.  By then we had ordered our food.  I'd say that it took about 25 minutes to deliver our food.  Way to long for BBQ and a nearly empty restaurant.  The food was nothing to write home about.  Just kinda neutral, which is why I only give one star.  The service the busboy provided was all I can see as a positive.

data.title: Limited choices
data.text:
Waiter was good but the food was so so. Better choices around.
Pasta with vehicle was fair, rib eye steak was not worth $25. Lots of TVs. Good place for watching sports.

data.title: Bad food
data.text: Bad steak bad wings ; except the waiter who was actually nice I recommend to not eat here. I returned my steak full of nerves to the kitchen. No news since then

data.title: Crapy meat full of nerves
data.text:
Well I order the chef special; 12 oz of steak. It took forever to be served and when it finally happened I struggle to cut the steak. I asked the waiter to return my plate to the cook and asked him to try to cut himself this meat.
The waiter is nice; we are 4 only the 2 of us who ordered a burger like it.
I recommend to go elsewhere

data.title: Sriracha wings
data.text:
I have been using Sriracha hot sauce for 30 years and was super excited when I discovered the Sriracha wings offered by JP23 at Taste of Anaheim.  They were so flavorful and tasty, I decided to visit the restaurant to try other entrees.  We entered the restaurant and admired a glass-enclosed waterfall.  No one was at the reception desk (this was lunch time), so after two minutes of waiting, we wandered farther into the restaurant and were seated. (Later, there was another party waiting at the entrance that gave up and left. JP23 may want to have a host/hostess up front so they don't lose any business that way.)

There are many TVs (broadcasting World Cup or any other sporting event).  The bar looked pretty extensive, with around 20 beers on tap.

We ordered the Sriracha wings (awesome and garlicky just like last time), baby back ribs (they were dry rubbed and we dipped them in berry bourbon, citric, and chipotle BBQ sauces), and brisket sandwich (very tender and melted in our mouths). For sides, we chose sweet potato fries, and bacon mac and cheese.  I walked out of the restaurant with a spicy, happy tingling in my mouth. Everything was delicious and I am looking forward to going back and trying more!

TIP:  You can go the the JP23 yelp website and pay $5 for $10 gift certificate to use:)

data.title: JP23 BBQ Smokehouse celebrates its 1st anniversary in Fullerton, CA
data.text:
P23Wings are slow cooked and smoked with pecan, cherry, and hickory wood. The Honey Chili Wings were sweet and slightly spicy. It was reminiscent of a sweet Asian chili sauce commonly served with lumpia. The smoked flavor from the wings came through and paired well with the sauce. They were tender and juicy. Thumbs up, way up!

Sriracha Roasted Garlic Wings are spicy, yet was slightly countered from the sweet roasted garlic. The sriracha flavor permeated the chicken down to the bone. I'd take these on any day over plain old Buffalo Wings. Thumbs up, way up!

Meaty Beef Ribs are dry rubbed using JP23 seasonings and allowed to rest for 24 hours. After the seasoning sets, they are slow cooked by "Elmer" for 6 to 7 hours to "fall-off-the-bone" tenderness.  The beef was good on its own with just the dry rub, but if you need to slather sauce on your ribs, the Chipotle and Original paired the best. The collard greens were flavorful, yet not too salty or vinegary, with generous amounts of BACON! The Texas toast was crispy and gently flavored not to overpower the BBQ. Thumbs up!

Smoked Beef Brisket Dinner is an 8 oz. portion of tender Angus Grade-A beef brisket slowly cooked by "Elmer" and then hand carved for your plate. The brisket was tender, juicy and full of smoky flavor that just melts in your mouth like butter. This could make a great hearty baguette sandwich as well. It had enough flavor on its own, but if you need sauce, the Berry Bourbon and Original paired the best. Three Cheese Bacon Macaroni & Cheese had enormous cheesy flavor. The bacon added a smoky, salty flavor to the mix. The cornbread was dense with sweet maple flavor and actual kernels of corn still inside. Thumbs up!

data.title: Good food, Unorganized Staff
data.text:
2nd visit. Went to watch big boxing match because the place has large screens and flat screens throughout. The food is good-mostly bar food, nachos and BBQ. The staff try but they are poorly managed and understaffed-owners were present but clueless.
I hope they can get it together because the food was good and in a very good spot in Fullerton.

data.title: Disappointing pulled pork
data.text: I've spent a lot of time down south and love good pulled pork. I was disappointed in my sandwich, the meat didn't have a lot of flavor and already had BBQ sauce on it when it was served. They advertised house sauces, which were delicious, but had to compete with the basic sauce that was already on the sandwich.

data.title: great food
data.text: There is a new chief. He's making great food. I had the rib tips they were great. I also had the Chicago hot link , it comes with peppers and onions..so good and the bake beans ..they are great..

data.title: dry and disappointing
data.text: We went in for late lunch early dinner. I ordered the brisket. It was very dry and tough. Mine came with what was called corn. It was hard crumbly inedible.  My  husband ordered what was called a chicago sausage sandwich for 8 dollars. It was described as a hotlink. It was just a hot dog with little flavor. Worst food we have had. Our waitress was nice, but never came back and never asked how the food was, even when she brought the check. It was as though she knew. They were not busy. Will not go back.

data.title: Sometimes you want to go where everybody knows your name....not here.
data.text:
Was in the mood for BBQ when my wife recommended a new BBQ restaurant in Fullerton, Ca.  Upon our arrival, we walked in and found the atmosphere to be clean and inviting with approx. 25+ televisions with sports on the tube (nice).  As we looked around for a hostess or waitress for seating directions (since there's a hostess podium near the front door) for the next few minutes we were greeted by stares from who we originally thought were other customers enjoying the game.  We eventually located a waiter who directed us to a table.

The waiter recommended their two top specialties (ribs and brisket) at which time we took his recommendation and ordered one of each.  

As we waited for our food and enjoyed watching the baseball game we noticed that those "customers" who stared at us when we first walked in eventually left their table and began working in the restaurant.  These customers were actually employees!  

Our main course arrived in about 15 minutes.  The ribs were smoked to perfection and the brisket was dry.  They have 4 different types of BBQ sauce to try but we settled on the original recipe (which wasn't so tasty).  We personally like the old store bought bbq sauce so maybe that's what were accustomed to.  If you enjoy ribs without any sauce then these ribs are for you.  Overall the rest of the meal was on the bland side and just okay.  

If you're looking for a place to watch a sports game and drink a beer then this is the right place.

The location is at the corner of a busy intersection and in a premium spot but so far every business that has opened there has only lasted 12-18 months and unfortunately, I see the same for this place.  We had some high hopes but at the end of the day.......there'll be no cheers here.
